The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Acrocoryne has a short-lived bloom period, typically lasting only a few days, which makes it a rare and sought-after specimen among botanists and collectors. Its botanical significance lies in its unusual morphology and limited distribution, contributing to its status as an exotic and enigmatic species.
